meanings.definition: To nod the head slightly as a sign of agreement or acknowledgment.
meanings.sent1: She noddled when asked if she understood.
meanings.sent2: He noddled in agreement during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The teacher noddled at the student's correct answer.
meanings.sent4: The audience noddled along with the speaker's points.
meanings.sent5: The dog noddled happily when its owner returned home.

meanings.definition: To cook pasta until it is just tender.
meanings.sent1: Mom noddled the pasta for dinner.
meanings.sent2: The chef noddled the spaghetti perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The kids eagerly awaited the noddled macaroni and cheese.
meanings.sent4: The restaurant noddled the noodles to perfection.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the noddled pasta filled the kitchen.

meanings.definition: To hit someone on the head lightly.
meanings.sent1: He noddled his brother playfully on the head.
meanings.sent2: The prankster noddled his friend during the joke.
meanings.sent3: The comedian noddled the volunteer on stage for a laugh.
meanings.sent4: The child noddled the balloon above his sister's head.
meanings.sent5: The pillow fight ended with a gentle noddle on the head.
